mal:service.comment: The power service allows the user to control the power state of the on-board devices.
mal:service.name: Power

mal:submitIP.comment: The setPowerState sets the power state of selected devices. NOTE: Only ground segment has full control on the power state changing (APID filtering is performed).
mal:submitIP.name: setPowerState

mal:field.comment: The 'devices' field shall contain the list of devices for which the power state change should be applied. If one or more of the devices is not recognized, then an UNKNOWN error will be raised.
mal:field.name: devices

mal:field.comment: The 'powerStates' field shall contain the list of MAL::Boolean objects that corresponds to the elements in the device list. If the MAL::Boolean object on the list contains the value of 'TRUE' then the corresponding device should be powered on; otherwise it should be powered off.
mal:field.name: powerStates

mal:errorRef.comment: One or more of the devices specified in the list do not exist. The indexes of the unrecognized devices shall be contained in the extra information field.

mal:service.comment: The experiment watchdog service is provided by the OBC and shall be used by the experiments to signal that they are still running.
mal:service.name: ExperimentWD

mal:sendIP.comment: The alive operation should be called every TBD seconds by an experiment to inform the OBC that it is still running.
mal:sendIP.name: alive

mal:service.comment: The GPS service allows the user to obtain data samples from the GPS device.
mal:service.name: GPS

mal:invokeIP.comment: The getGPSData operation allows a consumer to receive requested data from the GPS device (for example, GPGSA data frame).
mal:invokeIP.name: getGPSData

mal:field.comment: The 'command' field shall contain a request encoded as an ASCII string to be sent to the GPS receiver.
mal:field.name: command

mal:field.comment: The response shall contain the received GPS data frame encoded as a string of ASCII characters.
mal:field.name: data

mal:errorRef.comment: No response was provided from the GPS receiver.

mal:enumeration.comment: PayloadDevice is an enumeration representing the possible payload devices that could be serviced.
mal:enumeration.name: PayloadDevice
